snippet: It takes a reputation to make a reputation. International rankings have become so influential that some countries use them to set policy.
abstract: London magazine Times Higher Education releases its list of World Reputation Rankings for universities; like influential US News and World Report lists, international academic rankings are increasingly impossible to ignore, as good reputation means more applications, more tuition dollars and greater levels of alumni giving.
lead_paragraph: It takes a reputation to make a reputation. International rankings have become so influential that some countries use them to set policy.

headline.main: Vying for a Spot on the World’s A List
headline.print_headline: Vying for a Spot On the World’s A List
